page.title: 06HEVERSHAM HALL
page.content: Parts of Heversham Hall are 985 years old. It is a dairy farm, with 80 dairy cows, l00 heffers and two bulls. Each morning Mr. and Mrs. Handly get up at 6.00 p.m. and milk the cows. The milking parlour has ten spaces five each side, the cows wait their turn in a space. When it is their turn, the next ten cows are let in. They go into their spaces. There is a well in the floor about four feet down where you stand. In this space there are controls to let the cows have food while they are milked. The amount of food can be varied to suit each cow. There are four suction plugs which are put on the cows udders. The milk goes into a glass truck jar to see how much milk they are giving then they record it. The milk empties into a refrigerator tank where it is churned to keep fresh till the milk tanker
